attributes.action: Stop the Proposed PIP Reforms That Will Harm Disabled People
attributes.additional_details:
🔹 PIP fraud – Government data from the DWP (2024) reports a 0.0% fraud rate.  
🔹 Mental health – 70% say the PIP assessment process worsens their mental health. (Disability Benefits Consortium, 2023). Disabled people 3x more prone to suicide, with PIP stress a key factor to mental decline. (University of Glasgow, 2022) 
🔹 Proposed changes strip disabled people of independence – The replacement of cash with refund schemes, deliberately create barriers to aids, and add needless bureaucracy
attributes.background:
1.	Withdraw proposed PIP reforms outlined in the Green Paper.
	2.	Maintain direct financial support rather than reimbursement schemes.
	3.	Agree an independent, fair, transparent, evidence-based assessment of disability benefits.
	4.	Involve disabled people in policy decisions affecting them

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign the following petition, which calls for similar action:

Stop PIP Cuts: Protect Support for Disabled People
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/721918
